intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to create and test a plug-in extension using PDE.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Open the plug-in editor
item.description:
To open the plug-in editor (if it is not already open), expand the com.example.helloworld tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the plugin.xml file.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Define a view extension
item.description: To define a view extension, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Extensions" tab within the plug-in editor to display the "Extensions" page
Click the "Add" button to open the "New Extension" wizard
Select "org.eclipse.ui.views" from the "Extension Points" list box and click "Finish"

item.title: Add a view category
item.description: To define a view category, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "org.eclipse.ui.views" in the list box under "All Extensions" heading in the "Extensions" page
Right-click and select "New->category" from the context menu
Replace the content of the "id" text box under "Extension Element Details" with "com.example.helloworld.view.helloworldcategory"
Replace the content of the "name" text box with "Hello World!"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Add a view
item.description: To define a view, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "org.eclipse.ui.views" in the list box under "All Extensions" heading in the "Extensions" page
Right-click and select "New->view" from the context menu
Replace the content of the "id" text box under "Extension Element Details" with "com.example.helloworld.view.helloworldview"
Replace the content of the "name" text box with "Hello World!"
Replace the content of the "class" text box with "com.example.helloworld.view.SampleView"
Replace the content of the "category" text box with "com.example.helloworld.view.helloworldcategory"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Create a view class
item.description: To create a view class, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Click the "class" hyperlink under "Extension Element Details" to start the "New Java Class" wizard
Accept the default values and click the "Finish" button to exit the wizard

item.title: Add view class code
Test the plug-in
item.description: To test your Eclipse plug-in inside a target Eclipse platform, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Open the plug-in editor
Select the "Overview" tab to display the "Overview" page
Click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading
Select "Window->Show View->Other..." from the main menu in the newly launched Eclipse platform
Note the "Hello World!" category and expand its tree dialog
Select the "Hello World!" view and click the "OK" button
Select "File->Exit" from the main menu to exit the target Eclipse platform
